intro: Galium esquirolii, commonly known as the Sierra marsh bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pinkish flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and meadows. Galium esquirolii is often found in California and is adapted to the region's temperate climate.
